data.value:
REGISTRATION COMPLETE
Dear {FirstName},
 
You have successfully activated your personal Amgen CPD Portal.
 
Please take note of your username and password which you will be required to enter each time you access your personal online portal at https://amgen.ccpdhm.com

Please keep this information confidential and do not share or forward your username and password:

Please sign -in with your username and password at https://amgen.ccpdhm.com to familiarize with the web portal and its’ functionalities. .
 
Should you have any questions or require any assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us at amgen@ccpdhm.com

With best regards,
The CCPDHM Web Portal Team
E: amgen@ccpdhm.com

data.value:
ALL MUST BE PRESENT:

Criteria 1: Adult male or female patients with a diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus (CDA definition)

Criteria 2: Most recent A1C >7.0%
Criteria 3: Current treatment with lifestyle and at least one antihyperglycemic agent(s)

data.name: HOME_INDEX
data.value:
"

NEWS & UPDATES

Welcome to your Personal PROTECT DM Portal

Next Steps:  “Physician Specific Requirements” Section
1. Review and Complete the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU)
2. Complete the Payee Form

Please get familiarized with the PROTECT DM program components and identify ten (10) patients that meet the eligibility criteria: VIEW: Eligibility Criteria

  • The Practice Assessment Survey and Forms will be accessible for completion in June.


Dear Colleague,


On behalf of the Canadian Heart Research Centre and the PROTECT DM Planning Committee, we welcome you to your personal online portal and thank you for taking part in this initiative. The PROTECT DM Program is coordinated by the Canadian Heart Research Centre (CHRC; www.chrc.net), a not-for-profit academic organization specializing in quality improvement initiatives, and is supported by Novo Nordisk.


The PROTECT DM program will allow you to confidentially assess your practice needs and will facilitate knowledge translation through evidence-based clinical decision making support. The decision to follow the recommendations is left to your discretion.


The PROTECT DM program has been reviewed and approved by OPTIMUM Clinical Research Inc., an independent, central Ethics Review Board. 


The online portal has been created to provide you with timely access to the program materials and educational tools as well as provide you with a convenient way to manage the program documents and complete the Electronic Practice Assessment (e-PAFs) and Measure Assessment Forms (e-MAFs). Please keep your username and password confidential. 


In order to download documents, you will need to enable cookies in your browser. Please follow the link for additional information: Enabling Cookies  


Please take a few minutes to familiarize yourself with the program requirements and the site functionalities. Download:  PROTECT DM Program Overview 


The PROTECT DM team is happy to assist you with any questions. Please do not hesitate to contact us at any time: Contact Us


We look forward to collaborating with you.


With best regards,



Lawrence A. Leiter, MD
PROTECT DM Chair
Division of Endocrinology and Metabolism

St. Michael’s Hospital
Professor of Medicine and Nutritional Sciences

University of Toronto
"

data.name: INCLUDE_NAME
data.value: Please include your First Name, Last Name City and Province

data.name: MAFP1_Atleast1Present
data.value: At LEAST 1 must be present in EITHER Cohort IA, IB or Cohort II as shown below

data.name: MAFP1_cohort2
data.value: Cohort II: No Prior CVD BUT Age ≥60 years AND ≥1 of the following: (Check ALL that APPLY)

data.name: MAFP1_cohortIA
data.value: Cohort IA: Prior CVD (Check ALL that APPLY in Cohort IA and/or IB)

data.name: MAFP1_DurationBetweenDates
data.value: Duration between the last two visits:

data.name: MAFP1_PleaseComplete
data.value: Please complete based on the most recent visit or the most recently available

data.name: MAFP1_Recentappointment
data.value: (i.e. between the two most recent appointment dates)

data.name: MAFP1_SelectCohorot
data.value: Select the cohort to which this patient was assigned at the previous visit

data.name: MAFP4_PleaseComplete
data.value: Please complete based on the most recent visit

data.name: MAFP5_A1CAchieve
data.value: This patient has achieved the CDA recommended A1C target of ≤ 7.0%

data.name: MAFP5_A1CAppropriate
data.value: This patient's most recent A1C is appropriate for this patient

data.name: MAFP5_BelieveEmpagliflozin
data.value: I believe empagliflozin is the appropriate choice based on this patient's characteristics and the CVOT trial results

data.name: MAFP5_blackheading
data.value:
In patients with clinical cardiovascular disease, the CDA guidelines recommend, as a priority, an AHA agent with demonstrated CV benefit (empagliflozin or liraglutide).

* EMPA-REG: Included patients with existing cardiovascular disease
** LEADER: Included patients with existing cardiovascular disease or ≥60 years at high risk for CVD

data.name: MAFP5_Box1Heading
data.value: You are managing this patient according to guideline recommendations and the landmark CVOT trial results.

data.name: MAFP5_Box3Heading
data.value: You have initiated an antihyperglycemic agent with demonstrated CV outcome benefit based on this patient's clinical characteristics

data.name: MAFP5_Box5Cv_Outcome
data.value: Please select <u class="blueTXT"> the most applicable reason </u> for not prescribing an agent with demonstrated CV outcome benefit for this patient?

data.name: MAFP5_defer
data.value: I will defer to the patient's other health care provider(s) to modify the management plan to improve glycemic control

data.name: MAFP5_efficacy
data.value: I need more time to evaluate the efficacy of the current treatment plan

data.name: MAFP5_GlycemicSteps
data.value: What is your next step in the glycemic management of this patient?

data.name: MAFP5_Healthcare
data.value: Patient's other health care provider initiated this treatment

data.name: MAFP5_inititating
data.value: I will consider inititating an additional antihyperglycemic agent to improve glycemic control

data.name: MAFP5_MedicalConstraints
data.value: Medical Constraints (e.g. co-morbid conditions, contraindications, patient's age)

data.name: MAFP5_NotAchieveA1C
data.value: This patient has not achieved the CDA recommended A1C target of ≤ 7.0%.

data.name: MAFP5_NotComfortable
data.value: I am not comfortable with initiating an injectable treatment

data.name: MAFP5_PrescribingEmpagliflozin
data.value: Please select <u class="blueTXT">the most applicable reason</u> for prescribing empagliflozin rather than liraglutide for this patient?

data.name: MOU10
data.value: Complete the electronic Practiceand Measure Assessment Forms (e-PAFs) forms on patients that meet the program eligibility criteria in adherence with the program timelines;

data.name: MOU11
data.value: Provide a copy of your medical license and a current Curriculum Vitae if requested by the CHRC;

data.name: MOU12
data.value: Be available to answer any data queries;

data.name: MOU13
data.value: Exercise reasonable and diligent efforts and professional expertise in the conduct and completion of the program documents in an efficient and timely manner and in compliance with the program instructions.

data.name: MOU24
data.value: Participating physician will have the following responsibilities with respect to Confidential Information:

data.name: MOU25
data.value: Confidential Information: defined as confidential or proprietary information of the CHRC and/or the Sponsor either disclosed orally or in writing to or otherwise learned by the participating physician through participation in the PROTECT DM program that should reasonably be known to be confidential or proprietary to the CHRC and/or the Sponsor, including but not limited to: research, development and clinical programs, data and results, educational products, inventions, works of authorship, trade secrets, processes, conceptions, formulas, patents, patent applications, and licenses, business, product, marketing, sales, scientific and technical strategies, programs and results, including costs and prices, suppliers, manufacturers, customers, market data, personnel, and consultants and other confidential matters related to the CHRC and/or the Sponsor.

data.name: MOU27
data.value: Shall not use Confidential Information except for the purpose of evaluating, negotiating and/or participating in the PROTECT DM program;

data.name: MOU28
data.value: Will hold Confidential Information in strictest confidence and shall not disclose Confidential Information to others, except for its employees or agents who require Confidential Information for the purpose of evaluating or negotiating the business relationship in relation to the PROTECT DM program and who are subject to binding obligations of confidentiality and restricted use, participating physician shall be solely responsible for compliance with the terms of Confidential Information by such employees or agents;

data.name: MOU29
data.value: Will protect the confidentiality of Confidential Information using at least the same level of efforts and measures used to protect its own confidential information, and at least commercially reasonable efforts and measures, including without limitation limiting access to Confidential Information commensurate with the purposes of this MOU and keeping adequate records of those with access to Confidential Information and of all uses or dispositions of Confidential Information;

data.name: MOU30
data.value: Will notify the CHRC as promptly as practicable of any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information;

data.name: MOU31
data.value: Acknowledges and agrees that there are no known circumstances which would place the participating physician in a conflict of interest as a result of the performance of the PROTECT DM program.

data.name: MOU32
data.value: The CHRC will have the following responsibilities:

data.name: MOU33
data.value: Provide all the necessary program materials to the participating physician

data.name: MOU34
data.value: Be available to answer questions in relation to the PROTECT DM program documents, instructions and/or the completion of the practice assessment forms / practice re-assessment forms;

data.name: MOU35
data.value: Provide physicians with remuneration for properly completed program components as following:

data.name: MOU37
data.value: Practice Assessment Forms: $60.00 per interactive electronic practice assessment form (up to $600.00 for the completion of ten (10) interactive electronic practice assessment forms);

data.name: MOU38

data.name: MOU38_SP
data.value: Measure Assessment Forms: $40.00 per interactive measure assessment form (up to $400.00 for the completion of ten (10) interactive electronic measure assessment forms).

data.name: MOU39
data.value: Phase II: Practice Assessment: $75.00 per electronic practice assessment form (up to $750.00 for the completion of ten (10) interactive electronic practice assessment forms)

data.name: MOU40
data.value: Phase II: Practice Re-Assessment A: $30.00 per electronic per electronic measure assessment form (up to $300.00 for the completion of ten (10) interactive electronic measure assessment forms)

data.name: MOU41
data.value: Phase II: Practice Re-Assessment B: $30.00 per electronic per electronic measure assessment form (up to $300.00 for the completion of ten (10) interactive electronic measure assessment forms)

data.name: MOU42
data.value: Program Evaluation: $100.00 for the completion of the program evaluation

data.name: MOU43
data.value: Participants who complete all the required program components will be compensated $2,300.00

data.value: By participating in the PROTECT DM Program the relationship of the participating physician to the CHRC is that of an independent contractor. Physician shall have no authority to make agreements with third parties that are binding on the CHRC.

data.value: Please review the following information and make yourself familiar with the PROTECT DM program components, as well as your expected role as a program participant, and the CHRC's role, as the coordinating centre.

data.name: NAP1_Instructionboxmain
data.value:
• Please complete the Practice Assessment Survey in its entirety. Your survey responses can only be viewed by you and individual survey results will never be shared
  • The survey consists of two (2) pages and should take between 10 – 15 minutes to complete
  • Click the “Save” button, to save the progress of the current page
  • Once you have completed the entire page, click the “Next” button to proceed to the next page of the survey.  Clicking the “Next” button will automatically save the entries of the previous page (if entirely completed)
  • To return to the previous page of the survey, click the “Back” button. Please make sure you “Save” your entries prior to clicking the “Back” button
  • Once you have completed the survey and click “Next” on Page 2, you can either:
    • Click the “Review” button to return to Page 1 of the survey to review your entries and/or make changes to your responses
    • Click the “Submit” button once you are satisfied with your responses and consider the survey as final.  Once the survey is submitted, you will not be able to make changes to your responses but will be able to return and view your responses.
  • Once the Practice Assessment Survey is submitted, the status in your dashboard will change to a checkmark ()
  • The CHRC will remunerate you $100.00 for completing the Practice Assessment Survey

data.value: Are available in my practice, but not easy to access rapidly

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q16_A3
data.value: Are available and integrated into my charting system (e.g., flow sheets with embedded guidelines, personal digital assistants [PDAs])

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q16_A4
data.value: Are available, supported by physician education, and integrated into care through reminders and other proven behavior change methods

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q17
data.value: My practice follows the following protocol for informing patients about guidelines:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q17_A1
data.value: I do not regularly inform patients about guidelines

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q17_A2
data.value: I give patients guideline handouts if they ask for them

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q17_A3
data.value: I routinely give patients a copy of guidelines or refer them to the appropriate website pertinent to their care

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q17_A4
data.value: I routinely give patients guidelines with personalized targets for them to achieve and with recommendations about how to achieve the targets

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q18_A1
data.value: I have to do almost everything if I want to be sure my patients who have diabetes receive the care they need

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q18_A2
data.value: Although we don't talk about "teams," I do have competent staff to assist me in providing excellent care for my patients who have diabetes

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q18_A3
data.value: I have regular staff meetings in which we discuss specific issues to improve care of our patients who have diabetes

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q18_A4
data.value: I am part of an interdisciplinary diabetes team and everyone understands their role in caring for patients who have diabetes

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q19_A2
data.value: Is scheduled by the patient at the end of each visit

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q19_A3
data.value: Is scheduled by the practice in accordance with guidelines

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q19_A4
data.value: Is scheduled by the practice in accordance with guidelines with routine appointment reminders to the patient

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q19_A5
data.value: Is proactive with patient recall system and routine appointment reminders

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20
data.value: In my practice, planned visits for patients who have diabetes:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20_A2
data.value: Are used if patients are not doing well or need refills

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20_A3
data.value: Are used if patients are not doing well. Reminder cards are used, but there is no long-term planning for regular visits

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20_A4
data.value: Checklists and flow sheets are used, in addition to other tools, to ensure key elements of care are provided

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20_A5
data.value: Are used for all patients and include regular assessment, preventive interventions, and attention to self-management support

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20_A6
data.value: Are used systematically to optimize patient follow-up; in addition, missed elements of planned care are easily spotted through an alert system

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q21
data.value: In my practice, coordination of care between my office and subspecialists:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q21_A2
data.value: Is done reasonably well, but depends mostly on written communication between my office, subspecialists and other relevant providers

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q21_A3
data.value: Is done quite well, with adequate oral and written communication between my office, subspecialists, and other relevant providers

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q21_A4
data.value: Is a high priority and includes active coordination between my office, subspecialists, and other relevant groups

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q22
data.value: In my practice, a diabetes registry:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q22_A2
data.value: Is used to maintain patient information, such as name, diagnosis, contact information, and date of last contact, either on paper or in a computer database

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q22_A3
data.value: Is used to identify patients regarding specific clinical information (e.g., data collection for measuring/tracking, identifying patients for planned visits or group visits)

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q22_A4
data.value: Is tied to guidelines and provides prompts and reminders about needed services (e.g., lab and other testing), and/or is an integral function of our electronic health record

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q23
data.value: Reminders to physicians and other team members:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q23_A2
data.value: Include general notifications of the existence of a diagnosis of diabetes, but do not describe needed services at the time of encounter

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q23_A3
data.value: Include indications of needed services for populations of patients through periodic reporting

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q23_A4
data.value: Include specific information for the team about guideline adherence at the time of individual patient encounters

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q24
data.value: In my practice, performance feedback regarding diabetes care:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q24_A2
data.value: Is provided at infrequent intervals and/or about a limited number of patients

data.name: PAF_INFO
data.value:
FPG ≥7.0 mmol/L
Fasting = no caloric intake for at least 8 hours
or
A1C ≥6.5% (in adults)
Using a standardized, validated assay, in the absence of factors that affect the accuracy of the A1C and not for suspected type 1 diabetes
or
2hPG in a 75-g OGTT ≥11.1 mmol/L
or
Random PG ≥11.1 mmol/L
Random= any time of the day, without regard to the interval since the last meal

2hPG = 2-hour plasma glucose; FPG = fasting plasma glucose; OGTT = oral glucose tolerance test; PG = plasma glucose

Goldenberg, R. et al Definition, Classification and Diagnosis of Diabetes, Prediabetes and Metabolic Syndrome . Can J Diabetes 2013;37(suppl 1): S8 - S11

data.name: PAP1_EligibilityCriteria
data.value:
Eligibility Criteria: ALL of the criteria must be present
  1. Male and female patients older than 18 years of age
  2. Diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus (CDA definition)
  3. At least ONE prior diabetes related visit
  4. Patient treated with at least ONE antihyperglycemic agent
  5. Next diabetes related visit to occur within the next 3 – 6 weeks

ASA (Clopidogrel if ASA intolerant) Therapy Required for Secondary Prevention:
• Macrovascular Disease

data.name: PAP5_Blackheading
data.value:
When clinical cardiovascular disease is a priority, the CDA guidelines recommend an AHA agent with demonstrated CV benefit (empagliflozin and liraglutide).
Additionally, the landmark CVOT LEADER Trial demonstrated benefit in patients with no history of CVD but age over 60 years and at least 1 CV Risk factor.

data.name: PCP_INDEX
data.value:
NEWS & UPDATES

Welcome to your Personal PROTECT DM Portal

Next Steps:  “Physician Specific Requirements” Section
1. Review and Complete the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU)
2. Complete the Payee Form

Please get familiarized with the PROTECT DM program components and identify ten (10) patients that meet the eligibility criteria: VIEW: Eligibility Criteria

  • The Practice Assessment Survey and Forms will be accessible for completion in June.


Dear Colleague,


On behalf of the Canadian Heart Research Centre and the PROTECT DM Planning Committee, we welcome you to your personal online portal and thank you for taking part in this initiative. The PROTECT DM Program is coordinated by the Canadian Heart Research Centre (CHRC; www.chrc.net), a not-for-profit academic organization specializing in quality improvement initiatives, and is supported by Novo Nordisk.


The PROTECT DM program will allow you to confidentially assess your practice needs and will facilitate knowledge translation through evidence-based clinical decision making support. The decision to follow the recommendations is left to your discretion.
The PROTECT DM program has been reviewed and approved by OPTIMUM Clinical Research Inc., an independent, central Ethics Review Board. 


The online portal has been created to provide you with timely access to the program materials and educational tools as well as provide you with a convenient way to manage the program documents and complete the Electronic Practice Assessment (e-PAFs) and Measure Assessment Forms (e-MAFs). Please keep your username and password confidential. 


In order to download documents, you will need to enable cookies in your browser. Please follow the link for additional information: Enabling Cookies  


Please take a few minutes to familiarize yourself with the program requirements and the site functionalities. Download:  PROTECT DM Program Overview 


The PROTECT DM team is happy to assist you with any questions. Please do not hesitate to contact us at any time: Contact Us


We look forward to collaborating with you.


With best regards,



Lawrence A. Leiter, MD
PROTECT DM Chair
Division of Endocrinology and Metabolism

St. Michael’s Hospital
Professor of Medicine and Nutritional Sciences

University of Toronto

data.name: SFB_Avoidance
data.value: Avoidance of hypoglycemia especially in the elderly, those with hypoglycemia unawareness, and those with criteria for less stringent control.

data.name: SFB_BMI
data.value: Calculate BMI (mass in kilograms/height in metres<sup>2</sup>)

data.name: SFB_CKD_IDEN
data.value:
Identification of CKD requires screening for proteinuria using random urine ACR (2 out of 3 samples over 3 mths) and assessment of renal function using a serum creatinine converted to eGFR
Type 2 diabetes: Screen at diagnosis and then yearly if no CKD.

data.name: SFB_Dyslipidemia2
data.value:
Fasting lipid levels (TC, HDL, TG and calculated LDL) at diagnosis, then yearly if treatment not initiated. More frequent testing if treatment initiated Statin therapy should be used to reduce cardiovascular risk in adults type 2 diabetes with any of the following features:
  • 1. Clinical macrovascular disease
  • 2. Age >=40 years
  • 3. Age <40 years and 1 of the following
    • diabetes duration>15 years and age >30 years
    • Microvascular complications
    • Warrants therapy based on the presence of other risk factors according to the 2012 Canadian Cardiovascular Society Guidelines for the Diagnosis and Treatment of Dyslipidemia

data.name: SFB_Dyslipidemia3
data.value: Lipid targets for those who need therapy:Primary target: LDL ≤2.0 mmol/L or ≥50% reduction Alternate Primary target: apo B ≤0.8 g/L or non-HDL-C ≤2.6 mmol/L

data.name: SFB_Enquire_Hypo
data.value: Enquire about hypoglycemia at each visit. Discuss recognition and treatment of hypoglycemia and risk/ benefit of hypoglycemia and pharmacologic management.

data.name: SFB_ENSURE
data.value: Ensure patient can use glucose meter, interpret results and modify treatment as needed. Develop an individualized blood glucose monitoring schedule with patient and review records.

data.name: SFB_Exam2
data.value: Type 2 diabetes: Screen at diagnosis, then annually. Screen for neuropathy with 10-g monofilament or 128 Hz tuning fork at dorsum of great toe. In foot exam look for: structural abnormalities, neuropathy, vascular disease, ulceration, infection

data.name: SFB_Exam3
data.value: Early detection and treatment. If neuropathy present: require foot care education, specialized footwear, smoking cessation. If ulcer present: manage by multidisciplinary team with expertise

data.name: SFB_LastPara
data.value: Adopted from Canadian Diabetes Association’s Sample Diabetes Care Flow Sheet for Adults

data.name: SFB_Measure
data.value: Measure A1C every three months for most adults. Consider testing at least every 6 months in adults during periods of treatment and lifestyle stability when glycemic targets have been consistently achieved

data.name: SFB_Measure2
data.value:
• A1C ≤7.0% for most patients with type 2 diabetes.
  • A1C ≤6.5% may be considered in some patients with type 2 diabetes to further lower the risk of nephropathy and retinopathy which must be balanced against the risk of hypoglycemia.
  • A1C of 7.1 – 8.5% may be considered for patients with type 2 diabetes based on limited life expectancy, functional dependency, extensive coronary artery disease at high risk of ischemia, multiple comorbidities, recurrent severe hypoglycemia, hypoglycemia unawareness, longstanding diabetes unable to achieve A1C ≤7% despite best efforts (including intensified insulin).

data.name: SFB_MeasureBP
data.value: Measure BP at diagnosis and at every diabetes clinic visit

data.name: SFB_NutritionEncourage
data.value: Encourage nutritional therapy (by a registered dietitian) as an integral part of treatment and self-management.

data.name: SFB_NutritionTarget
data.value: Meet nutritional needs by following Eating Well with Canada’s Food Guide

data.name: SFB_PARA
data.value: Adopted from Canadian Diabetes Association’s Sample Diabetes Care Flow Sheet for Adults

data.name: SFB_PA_DISCUSS
data.value: Discuss and encourage aerobic and resistance exercise. Evaluate those with possible CAD or microvascular complications undertaking exercise substantially more vigorous than brisk walking.

data.name: SFB_Premeal
data.value:
Premeal (mmol/L) = 4.0-7.0 mmol/L for most patients
2hr Postmeal (mmol/L) = 5.0-10.0 mmol/L for most patients
5.0-8.0 mmol/L if not achieving A1C target

data.name: SFB_Retinopathy2
data.value: Type 2 diabetes: Screen at diagnosis and 1-2 years after initial screening if no retinopathy is present. The interval for follow-up assessment should be tailored to the severity of the retinopathy. Screening should be conducted by an experienced eye care professional

data.name: SFB_Smoking_Encourage
data.value: Encourage patient to stop at each visit; provide support as needed

data.name: SFB_WaistMeasure
data.value: Measure as an indicator of abdominal fat

data.name: SFB_WaistMeasure2
data.value:
MEN:
Caucasian, African: ≥94 cm
Asian, South or Central American: ≥90 cm
WOMEN:
All women: ≥80 cm

data.name: USER_HELPER_PCPEMAIL
data.value:
REGISTRATION COMPLETE
Dear Dr. {LastName},
 
On behalf of the Canadian Heart Research Centre and the PROTECT DM Steering Committee,   we thank you for your interest in the PROTECT DM initiative and for taking the time to register online.
 
Please take note of your username and password which you will be required to enter each time you access your personal online portal at www.protectdm.ca

Please keep this information confidential and do not share or forward your username and password:
 
Your Username: {userName}    
Your Password: {password}

Next Steps:

Please ensure that you enable cookies in your browser. Please reference the attached guide for a step by step process.

Please sign -in with your username and password at www.protectdm.ca and complete the Memorandum of Understanding(MOU) and the Payee Form (located under the “Physician Specific Requirements” section in the left hand menu).
 
Please familiarize yourself with the program components (a synopsis is attached for your reference) and identify ten(10) patients that meet the eligibility criteria. You may then proceed to completing the Practice Assessment Survey and Forms (located under the “PROTECT DM Program Components” section in the left hand menu).

Should you have any questions or require any assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us at info@protectdm.ca

We look forward to working with you.
 
With best regards,

Lianne Goldin, CCMEP
On behalf of The CHRC PROTECT DM Team
Executive Director
E: lgoldin@chrc.net
T: 1 - 800 - 725 - 6585 ext. 229

"
